title: TypeScript Practice Problems

solutions.name: problem1Solution
solutions.approach: Add your approach here
solutions.code:
const problem1Solution = (start, diff, count) => {
  const array: number[] = [];
  for (let i = 0; i < count; i += 1) {
    array.push(i * diff + start);
  }
  return array;
};

solutions.name: problem2Solution
solutions.approach: Add your approach here
solutions.code:
const problem2Solution = (start, diff, count) => {
  return Array.from({ length: count }, (_, i) => i * diff + start);
};

testResults.name: Arithmetic with Array.from: start=2, diff=3, count=4

solutions.name: problem3Solution
solutions.approach: Add your approach here
solutions.code:
const problem3Solution = (start, ratio, count) => {
  const array: number[] = [];
  let i = 0;
  while (i < count) {
    array[i] = start * ratio ** i;
    i += 1;
  }
  return array;
};

solutions.name: problem4Solution
solutions.approach: Add your approach here
solutions.code:
const problem4Solution = (arr, predicate) => {
  const array: number[] = [];
  arr.forEach((n) => {
    if (predicate(n)) {
      array.push(n);
    }
  });
  return array;
};

solutions.name: problem5Solution
solutions.approach: Add your approach here
solutions.code:
const problem5Solution = (arr, transform) => {
  return arr.map(transform);
};

solutions.name: problem6Solution
solutions.approach: Add your approach here
solutions.code:
const problem6Solution = (arr) => {
  return arr.reduce((sum, n) => n + sum, 0);
};

solutions.name: problem7Solution
solutions.approach: Add your approach here
solutions.code:
const problem7Solution = (size) => {
  return Array.from({ length: size }, (_, i) =>
    Array.from({ length: size }, (_, j) => (i + 1) * (j + 1))
  );
};

solutions.name: problem8ForLoopSolution
solutions.approach: Add your approach here
solutions.code:
const problem8ForLoopSolution = (str) => {
  let reversedString = '';
  for (let i = str.length - 1; i >= 0; i -= 1) {
    reversedString += str.charAt(i);
  }
  return reversedString;
};

solutions.name: problem8SplitSolution
solutions.approach: Add your approach here
solutions.code:
const problem8SplitSolution = (str) => {
  return str.split('').reverse().join('');
};

solutions.name: problem8RecursionSolution
solutions.approach: Add your approach here
solutions.code:
const problem8RecursionSolution = (str) => {
  if (str === '' || str.length === 1) {
    return str;
  }
  return problem8RecursionSolution(str.slice(1)) + str.charAt(0);
};

solutions.name: problem9Solution
solutions.approach:
- Iterate the chars in the string
 - create a hash map of the seen characters
solutions.code:
const problem9Solution = (str) => {
  return str.split('').reduce<Record<string, number>>((obj, char) => {
    obj[char] = (obj[char] ?? 0) + 1;
    return obj;
  }, {});
};

solutions.name: problem10Solution
solutions.approach: Add your approach here
solutions.code:
const problem10Solution = (arr) => {
  const current: any[] = [arr];
  const answer: any[] = [];
  while (current.length) {
    const item = current.shift();
    if (Array.isArray(item)) {
      current.push(...item);
    } else {
      answer.push(item);
    }
  }
  return answer;
};

solutions.name: problem11Solution
solutions.approach:
- Iterate the numbers in the array
 - Compare the number and the current maximum
 - Replace the current maximum with the number if the number is greater
solutions.code:
const problem11Solution = (arr) => {
  let max: number = -Infinity;
  arr.forEach((n) => {
    max = Math.max(max, n);
  });
  return max;
};

solutions.name: problem12Solution
solutions.approach:
- Iterate the characters from left to right and right to left
 - Compare the characters at the two pointers
solutions.code:
const problem12Solution = (str) => {
  const end = Math.ceil(str.length / 2);
  for (let i = 0; i < end; i += 1) {
    if (str.charAt(i) !== str.charAt(str.length - 1 - i)) {
      return false;
    }
  }
  return true;
};

solutions.name: problem13Solution
solutions.approach:
- Iterate the elements in the array
 - Create a hash map of the seen elements
 - Remove the elements that were seen
solutions.code:
const problem13Solution = (arr) => {
  const seen = new Set<number>();
  return arr.filter((e) => {
    if (seen.has(e)) {
      return false;
    }
    seen.add(e);
    return true;
  });
};

solutions.name: problem14Solution
solutions.approach:
- Iterate the elements in the array
 - Return the index of the element if the element is the same as target
 - return -1 if all the elements are not the same as target
solutions.code:
const problem14Solution = (arr, target) => {
  return arr.indexOf(target);
};

solutions.name: problem15Solution
solutions.approach:
- Have two pointers
 - One pointer starts from the first element of the first array
 - One pointer starts from the first element of the second array
 - Move the pointer to the next one in its array only if the pointer is smaller than the other pointer
 - add the pointer to the result array before moving
solutions.code:
const problem15Solution = (arr1, arr2) => {
  const result: number[] = [];
  let i = 0,
    j = 0;
  while (i < arr1.length && j < arr2.length) {
    if (arr1[i] <= arr2[j]) {
      result.push(arr1[i++]);
    } else {
      result.push(arr2[j++]);
    }
  }
  return result.concat(arr1.slice(i), arr2.slice(j));
};

solutions.name: problem16Solution
solutions.approach: - Times the (step + 1) iteratively
solutions.code:
const problem16Solution = (n) => {
  let result = 1;
  for (let i = 1; i <= n; i += 1) {
    result *= i;
  }
  return result;
};

solutions.name: problem17Solution
solutions.approach:
- Iterate from 2 to the number - 1
 - See if the number can divide the number
solutions.code:
const problem17Solution = (n) => {
  if (n <= 1) {
    return false;
  }
  if (n === 2) {
    return true;
  }
  if (n % 2 === 0) {
    return false;
  }
  for (let i = 3; i < Math.sqrt(n); i += 2) {
    if (n % i === 0) {
      return false;
    }
  }
  return true;
};

solutions.name: problem18Solution
solutions.approach:
- Find the modulo of the (array length - target) divide the length of array
 - split the array at the modulo
 - combine the right split and left split
solutions.code:
const problem18Solution = (arr, k) => {
  const index = (arr.length - k) % arr.length;
  return arr.slice(index).concat(arr.slice(0, index));
};

solutions.name: problem19Solution
solutions.approach:
- Iterate the element in the array
 - Compare the element with the index
 - return the index if there's inconsistency
solutions.code:
const problem19Solution = (arr) => {
  if (arr.length === 0) {
    return 0;
  }
  const index = arr.findIndex((n, i) => i !== n);
  return index === -1 ? arr.length : index;
};

solutions.name: problem20Solution
solutions.approach:
- Find the first letter that has no letter before
 - Replace that with upper letter
solutions.code:
const problem20Solution = (str) => {
  return str.replace(/\b\w/g, (c) => c.toUpperCase());
};

solutions.name: problem21Solution
solutions.approach:
- Use a hash map to store number -> index mappings
 - For each number, check if its complement (target - number) exists in the map
 - If found, return the indices; otherwise, store current number and index
solutions.code:
const problem21Solution = (arr, target) => {
  const complement: Record<number, number> = {};
  for (let i = 0; i < arr.length; i += 1) {
    if (complement[arr[i]] != null) {
      return [target - arr[i], arr[i]];
    } else {
      complement[target - arr[i]] = i;
    }
  }
  return null;
};

solutions.name: problem22Solution
solutions.approach:
- Use a hash map to store vowels
 - for each character, check if vowels exists
solutions.code:
const problem22Solution = (str) => {
  let count = 0;
  for (const char of str) {
    if (vowels.has(char)) {
      count += 1;
    }
  }
  return count;
};

solutions.name: problem23Solution
solutions.approach:
- Iterate over the string
 - use a counter to store the current longest string
solutions.code:
const problem23Solution = (str) => {
  return str
    .split(' ')
    .reduce(
      (longest, word) => (longest.length < word.length ? word : longest),
      ''
    );
};

solutions.name: problem24Solution
solutions.approach:
- use 0, 1 as the beginning
 - for the rest of the steps, append the sum of the previous 2 numbers
solutions.code:
const problem24Solution = (n) => {
  if (n === 1) {
    return [0];
  }
  if (n === 2) {
    return [0, 1];
  }
  const result: number[] = Array.from({ length: n }, (_, i) => {
    if (i === 0) {
      return 0;
    }
    return 1;
  });
  for (let i = 2; i < n; i += 1) {
    result[i] = result[i - 1] + result[i - 2];
  }
  return result;
};

solutions.name: problem25Solution
solutions.approach:
- Iterate over the array
 - compare the current element with the last element
solutions.code:
const problem25Solution = (arr) => {
  return arr.every((n, i) => {
    if (i === 0) {
      return true;
    }
    return arr[i - 1] <= n;
  });
};

solutions.name: problem26Solution
solutions.approach:
- Iterate over the array
 - Track used indices to ensure each element is only used once
 - Return all valid pairs found
solutions.code:
const problem26Solution = (arr, target) => {
  const complement = new Set<number>();
  const result: [number, number][] = [];
  arr.forEach((n) => {
    if (complement.has(n)) {
      result.push([target - n, n]);
      complement.delete(n);
    } else {
      complement.add(target - n);
    }
  });
  result.sort((a, b) => a[0] - b[0]);
  return result;
};

solutions.name: problem27Solution
solutions.approach: - filter all the elements that are not equal to the value
solutions.code:
const problem27Solution = (arr, value) => {
  return arr.filter((n) => n !== value);
};

solutions.name: problem28Solution
solutions.approach: Add your approach here
solutions.code:
const problem28Solution = (arr) => {
  if (arr.length === 0) {
    return null;
  }
  return arr.reduce((sum, n) => sum + n, 0) / arr.length;
};

solutions.name: problem29Solution
solutions.approach:
- find the sets of two arrays
 - find the intersection of two sets
solutions.code:
const problem29Solution = (arr1, arr2) => {
  const set1 = new Set(arr1);
  const set2 = new Set(arr2);
  const intersection: number[] = [];
  set1.forEach((n) => {
    if (set2.has(n)) {
      intersection.push(n);
    }
  });
  return intersection;
};

solutions.name: problem30Solution
solutions.approach: - chunk the array by the target chunk size
solutions.code:
const problem30Solution = (arr, size) => {
  const result: number[][] = [];
  for (let i = 0; i < arr.length; i += size) {
    result.push(arr.slice(i, i + size));
  }
  return result;
};

notes:
1. TypeScript Practice Problems
  • Difficulty: easy
  • Tags: 'typescript', 'arrays', 'loops', 'fundamentals'
  • Description:
  • A collection of 30 practice problems to sharpen TypeScript/JavaScript fundamentals:
    1. Create arithmetic sequence using for loop
    1. Create arithmetic sequence using Array.from
    1. Create geometric sequence using while loop
    1. Filter array elements using forEach
    1. Transform array using map
    1. Sum array elements using reduce
    1. Create multiplication table using nested loops
    1. Reverse string using different methods (3 variations)
    1. Count character frequencies using object
    1. Flatten nested arrays recursively
    1. Find maximum value in array
    1. Check if string is palindrome
    1. Remove duplicates from array
    1. Find index of element in array
    1. Merge two sorted arrays
    1. Calculate factorial
    1. Check if number is prime
    1. Rotate array to the right
    1. Find missing number in sequence
    1. Convert string to title case
    1. Find two numbers that sum to target
    1. Count vowels in string
    1. Find longest word in string
    1. Generate Fibonacci sequence
    1. Check if array is sorted
    1. Find all pairs with given sum
    1. Remove all occurrences of value
    1. Calculate average of array
    1. Find common elements in two arrays
    1. Chunk array into groups
  • Constraints:
    • All problems use TypeScript types properly
    • Practice different loop types and array methods
    • Focus on clean, readable code
    • Build fundamental skills for algorithm problems
